programme.title: Zebra. Zebra Yr 9 (2025) Ep. 910
programme.desc: Raidījuma vadmotīvs ir nemainīgs – drošība un ātrums! Tēmu loks tāpat – satiksmes drošība, satiksmes organizācija un iespējamie risinājumi. Transportlīdzekļu vadītājiem un gājējiem saistošu likumu un noteikumu izmaiņas, Eiropas valstu pieredze satiksmes problēmu risināšanā. Sava daļa stāstu būs atvēlēta sportiem, kas saistīti ar ātrumu. Raidījums visiem, kas ceļā! Raidījuma vadītājs – Pauls Timrots.

programme.title: Kikbokseris: Atmaksa
programme.desc: Kikbokseris Kurts Slouns uzvar Losandželosas cīņas ringā, taču tad tiek apreibināts ar narkotikām un pamostas Taizemes cietumā. Slouns ir dziļi nelaimīgs – arī tāpēc, ka nekad vairs negribēja spert kāju šajā valstī. Lai atgūtu brīvību un izglābtu nolaupīto sievu, Slounam jāuzvar milzīgs cīkstonis.

programme.title: Sporta momenti
programme.desc: Dokumentālās sērijas aplūko aizraujošos stāstus, ko atklāj slavenākās fotogrāfijas sporta vēsturē. Iemūžinātie mirkļi ataino spilgtākos divdesmitā gadsimta atlētus, kā arī ilustrē svarīgus momentus, kas mainījuši sporta vēstures gaitu.

programme.title: Simpsoni 34
programme.desc: Vairāk nekā simts nomināciju un tikpat daudz balvu, zvaigzne Holivudas slavas alejā, episkas varoņu frāzes, kas iekļuvušas vārdnīcu lappusēs, pirmais “Playboy” animācijas tēla vāks vēsturē, nepārtrauktas pārraides vairāk nekā 30 gadu garumā, sveiciens no Vatikāna gadadienā un miljoniem fanu visā pasaulē! Šis ir animācijas seriāls “Simpsoni” un tā dzeltenie varoņi – Homērs, Mārdža, Bārts, Liza un mazā Megija!

programme.title: Simpsoni 11
programme.desc: Savas pastāvēšanas laikā seriāls vairākkārt ieguvis prestižas godalgas, tai skaitā jau 18 “Emmy” balvas. Homēra mīļākais teiciens “D’oh!” ir kļuvis par popkultūras ikonu un 2001.gadā iekļauts Oksfordas vārdnīcā. 2003.gada 16.februārī seriāla 300.sērijas “dzimšanas dienā” Simpsoni tika pie savas zvaigznes Holivudas Slavas alejā!

programme.title: Krietnie zagļi 2
programme.desc: Kādreiz Neitans Fords bija apdrošināšanas firmas izmeklētājs. Tagad viņš saaicinājis komandā vislabākos bijušos noziedzniekus. Viņi palīdz tiem cilvēkiem, kuri nevēlas vai nespēj atrisināt savas problēmas ar likumīgām metodēm un policijas palīdzību. Parasti tas nozīmē, ka viņiem ir jāapkrāpj blēži, kas iedzīvojušies uz sveša īpašuma rēķina un bieži vien pat skaitās sabiedrībā cienījami ļaudis. Neita komandā ietilpst datorģēnijs un hakeris Aleks Hārdisons, zagle un trakulīga dāma Pārkere, aktrise un krāpniece Sofija un plaša profila speciālists Eliots. Šie ļaudis ir retums, īstas pērles – zagļu komanda, par kuru godīgie tur īkšķi, lai viņiem izdodas!

programme.title: Antikvariāts uz riteņiem
programme.desc: Antīko lietu pārzinātāja Kristīna Trevainjona un amatnieks Vils Kērks apceļo Lielbritānijas mājsaimniecības, noslauka putekļus no tur atrastām, nenovērtētām pērlēm un atklāj to stāstus. Daudz nevilcinoties, šie dārgumu mednieki ķeras pie relikviju rūpīgas atjaunošanas un, kad lietas atguvušas agrāko spozmi, ļauj tām nonākt pareizajās rokās, dodot jaunu dzīvi.

programme.title: Antikvariāts uz riteņiem
programme.desc: Antīko lietu pārzinātāja Kristīna Trevainjona un amatnieks Vils Kērks apceļo Lielbritānijas mājsaimniecības, noslauka putekļus no tur atrastām, nenovērtētām pērlēm un atklāj to stāstus. Daudz nevilcinoties, šie dārgumu mednieki ķeras pie relikviju rūpīgas atjaunošanas un, kad lietas atguvušas agrāko spozmi, ļauj tām nonākt pareizajās rokās, dodot jaunu dzīvi.

programme.title: No zēna par vīru
programme.desc: Ceļotājs Tims Nonans dodas episkā piedzīvojumā uz pasaules skarbākajām vietām, lai savām acīm ieraudzītu dažus no pasaules sīkstākajiem vīriem. Dokumentālajās sērijās atklājas piedzīvojumu meklētāja divus gadus ilgais ceļojums uz nomaļiem pasaules nostūriem Brazīlijā, Kamerūnā, Kirgizstānā, Madagaskarā, Meksikā, Mongolijā, Jaungvinejā, Krievijā, Taizemē un Venecuēlā. Tur viņš iepazina maz pētītu cilšu kultūru, pamazām iemantoja iezemiešu uzticību un visbeidzot – piedzīvoja bīstamākos pilngadības rituālus un pārbaudījumus, kādi saglabājušies līdz mūsdienām.

programme.title: Pasaules spēkavīru čempionāts 2024
programme.desc: Pasaules spēkavīru sacensības pārbauda stiprinieku absolūtās robežas, metot izaicinājumu ne tikai viņu fiziskajam spēkam, bet arī veiklībai un garīgajai izturībai. Starp dalībniekiem arī Latvijas spēkavīrs Aivars Šmaukstelis, kuram pieder vairāki Ginesa rekordi.

programme.title: Nakts muzejā 2
programme.desc: Naktssargs Lerijs Deilijs (Bens Stillers) nu ir kļuvis par veiksmīgu uzņēmēju. Viņš apmeklē Dabas vēstures muzeju, lai apciemotu savus draugus eksponātus, kas pa naktīm mēdz atdzīvoties. Viņš uzzina, ka lielāko daļu no tiem ved projām uz Smitsona institūta arhīva tālākajiem nostūriem.

programme.title: Basketbols: NBA 2024/25. Phoenix Suns - Los Angeles Lakers
Pēdējā deja
programme.desc: Reti, vēl neredzēti kadri atklās līdz šim neizstāstīto stāstu par visu laiku slavenākā basketbolista Maikla Džordana pēdējo gadu Čikāgas "Bulls" sastāvā 1997.–1998. gada NBA sezonā.

programme.title: Pēdējā deja
programme.desc: Reti, vēl neredzēti kadri atklās līdz šim neizstāstīto stāstu par visu laiku slavenākā basketbolista Maikla Džordana pēdējo gadu Čikāgas "Bulls" sastāvā 1997.–1998. gada NBA sezonā.

programme.title: Kā rūpnīcas mainīja pasauli
programme.desc: Masveida ražošana ir nozīmīga mūsu dzīves daļa, taču tā dod iespēju ne tikai radīt un būvēt, bet arī iznīcināt un patērēt kā vēl nekad agrāk. Raidījumā tiek salīdzinātas pagātnes, tagadnes un nākotnes rūpnīcas, sākot no smagās rūpniecības un kara tehnikas izgatavošanas, līdz rūpnīcām, kas ražo pārtiku, apģērbu un citas ikdienas preces. Tāpat tiek novērtēta rūpnīcu ietekme uz apkārtējo ainavu, pilsētām un kultūru. Šī būs iespēja arī ielūkoties jaunāko tehnoloģiju sasniegumos un izzināt, kā rūpniecība varētu izskatīties nākotnē.

programme.title: Kā rūpnīcas mainīja pasauli
programme.desc: Masveida ražošana ir nozīmīga mūsu dzīves daļa, taču tā dod iespēju ne tikai radīt un būvēt, bet arī iznīcināt un patērēt kā vēl nekad agrāk. Raidījumā tiek salīdzinātas pagātnes, tagadnes un nākotnes rūpnīcas, sākot no smagās rūpniecības un kara tehnikas izgatavošanas, līdz rūpnīcām, kas ražo pārtiku, apģērbu un citas ikdienas preces. Tāpat tiek novērtēta rūpnīcu ietekme uz apkārtējo ainavu, pilsētām un kultūru. Šī būs iespēja arī ielūkoties jaunāko tehnoloģiju sasniegumos un izzināt, kā rūpniecība varētu izskatīties nākotnē.

programme.title: Female Spies of WWII
programme.sub-title: As the Allies cornered the Nazis, D-Day loomed and the Russians dominated the East, the SOE deployed their best agents to help free France; these were the wars boldest and most dazzling heroines.
programme.desc: This series tells the stories of talented female spies that overcame inherent sexism to put their lives on the line for their countries; their espionage efforts helped turn the tides of World War II.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: Amidst the smouldering ruins of WWII, Japan faced devastation unlike any the world had ever seen; the nation rebuilt itself to become a beacon of modern ingenuity, resilience, and remembrance.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Bomber: Terror of WWII
programme.sub-title: With the Battle of Britain over, the central experience of civilian bombing was suffered by Germany; in the Pacific War, the US and Japan successfully used bombing against naval and military targets.
programme.desc: There have been a catalogue of inventions in the history of warfare that have changed the way battles are fought, but one weapon changed not only the battlefield, but war itself: the bomber.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Zahi Hawass is excavating an enclosure called Gisr El-Mudir where sarcophagi containing mysterious mummies and rich painted tombs are discovered; will these treasures lead them to Imhotep?
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: The History of Mother Earth: Gaia Uncovered
programme.desc: Using ancient evidence and the latest NASA technology, historian Bettany Hughes explores the idea that the Earth is a living being and how ancient civilisations learned to respect the Earth.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: One of the richest men on Earth, Aristotle Onassis left a string of broken hearts in his wake, but no romance would catapult him into the limelight like his marriage to Jacqueline Kennedy.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: It is said that the Winchester family was haunted by the souls of those who were killed by the Winchester rifle. A series of personal misfortunes seemed to confirm the family was struck by a curse.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: The History of Mother Earth: Gaia Uncovered
programme.desc: Using ancient evidence and the latest NASA technology, historian Bettany Hughes explores the idea that the Earth is a living being and how ancient civilisations learned to respect the Earth.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Secret Lives of the Roman Emperors with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Acclaimed classicist Mary Beard explores what it was really like to be emperor of Rome, taking us behind palace walls to reveal the hidden world of the Roman imperial court and lifestyle.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: Espionage and intelligence were crucial during WWII; clever camouflage, the Enigma machine, and concealable weapons were as important as any tank, ship, aircraft or bomb.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: June 1942: the most decisive naval-air battle in the Pacific started as a Japanese trap and ended as an American ambush, a totally unpredictable conflict made up of luck, code-breaking, and gambles.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: January-May 1944: atop the hill in Monte Cassino lies an abbey whose commander has forbidden military use of; the abbey is reduced to rubble despite this and the fight claims over 200,000 deaths.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: January 1944: two divisions land at the Italian port of Anzio in one of the easiest Allied assaults of the war, but they fail to exploit their advantage, giving the German defenders time to reinforce.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: June 1944: a stretch of beach overlooked by fortified cliffs created a devastating baptism of fire. Failed plans, missed opportunities, and courage make this frontline a major turning point in WWII.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: October 1944: the Allies face a major supply crisis - vital fuel and ammunition still has to be landed at the D-Day beaches. When the port of Antwerp is liberated, it seems the crisis might be over.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: November 1944: as the Allies advance into Germany, they run into concrete bunkers, pillboxes, minefields and tank traps. German soldiers fight tenaciously to defend their homeland.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: December 1944: Hitler has picked the Ardennes sector for a major offensive. The surprise attack, spearheaded by elite divisions, initially sends American units reeling.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: March 1945: the Allies have reached the River Rhine. Montgomery plans a giant operation to cross the river in the north, but luck hands the Americans a bridge over the Rhine at Remagen.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: June 1944 - American, British and Canadian troops stormed the Normandy beaches along a 50-mile stretch. We look at the amphibious tanks and the heavy kit that weighed them down as they waded ashore.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: Auschwitz - One Day
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of a typical day in 1944 at the concentration camp of Auschwitz; it is based on a unique document which is kept in the Israeli memorial site of Yad Vashem.

programme.title: Female Spies of WWII
programme.sub-title: The Resistance in France was thrown into chaos in 1943; despite facing tough treatment by their German captors, female SOE officers showed amazing strength.
programme.desc: This series tells the stories of talented female spies that overcame inherent sexism to put their lives on the line for their countries; their espionage efforts helped turn the tides of World War II.

programme.title: Tsunami: The Day The Wave Hit
programme.sub-title: 15 minutes after the tsunami hit Thailand, it crashes into the east coast of Sri Lanka; despite being 1100 miles from the epicentre, the waves are travelling at the speed of a passenger jet.
programme.desc: We tell the story of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami through dramatic, and often heroic, individual stories with powerful - and sometimes unseen - archival footage while detailing the science behind it.

programme.title: Auschwitz - One Day
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of a typical day in 1944 at the concentration camp of Auschwitz; it is based on a unique document which is kept in the Israeli memorial site of Yad Vashem.

programme.title: Female Spies of WWII
programme.sub-title: The Resistance in France was thrown into chaos in 1943; despite facing tough treatment by their German captors, female SOE officers showed amazing strength.
programme.desc: This series tells the stories of talented female spies that overcame inherent sexism to put their lives on the line for their countries; their espionage efforts helped turn the tides of World War II.

programme.title: Female Spies of WWII
programme.sub-title: As the Allies cornered the Nazis, D-Day loomed and the Russians dominated the East, the SOE deployed their best agents to help free France; these were the wars boldest and most dazzling heroines.
programme.desc: This series tells the stories of talented female spies that overcame inherent sexism to put their lives on the line for their countries; their espionage efforts helped turn the tides of World War II.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The House of Romanov had imposed 300 years of strict Imperial rule, but royal authority was in question for the first time. The future of the Romanov dynasty was in danger.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: Starring in only a handful of films, Bruce Lee is revered as an icon in popular culture, but Lee died as young and as suddenly as his son. How could their tragic destinies share so many similarities?
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Treasures with Bettany Hughes
programme.sub-title: Turkey has been a crossroads for the Balkans, Caucasus, Middle East and the Mediterranean; Bettany travels to some of the most impressive and fascinating sites to reveal the countrys significance.
programme.desc: Professor Bettany Hughes travels across the world to investigate the story of humanity; making new discoveries along the way, she lifts the lid on the most remarkable treasures of civilisation.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Salem witch trials were a series of hearings and prosecutions of people accused of witchcraft in colonial Massachusetts in 1692 and 1693; the state eventually pardoned those who died.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Vatican City has its own laws, police, and - unbelievably - its own ATMs that print out in Latin. Its a secret world of libraries, holy relics and artwork that does not allow access outsiders.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Queens That Changed The World
programme.sub-title: For centuries Hatshepsut demanded to be represented as male complete with beard in contemporary depictions; she was in fact a brilliant queen who brought wealth and artistry to Ancient Egypt.
programme.desc: For so long believed to be side characters in histories dominated by men, some queens wielded extraordinary power; we discover how six women ruled in ways that far surpassed their male counterparts.

programme.title: Royals at War
programme.sub-title: We focus on the ambiguous relationship that existed between Hitler and the royal families and show how Hitler gradually wove his web around this loose constellation of aristocrats.
programme.desc: This two-part documentary examines the strategies used by the royal families of Europe during World War II in the face of increasingly powerful nationalist parties.

programme.title: Royals at War
programme.sub-title: As war seemed to grow closer, monarchs still did not step up their collaboration; it was only once Europe was under the Nazi yoke that alliances were renewed between rulers.
programme.desc: This two-part documentary examines the strategies used by the royal families of Europe during World War II in the face of increasingly powerful nationalist parties.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: Amidst the smouldering ruins of WWII, Japan faced devastation unlike any the world had ever seen; the nation rebuilt itself to become a beacon of modern ingenuity, resilience, and remembrance.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: Julius Caesar wanted to bring all of Gaul under his control, triggering a series of events that would bring his army to the brink of defeat - now archaeologists are uncovering what really happened.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: We explore the events triggered by the uniting of Gaul tribes under freedom fighter Vercingetorix, and archaeologists find evidence of the defences that the Gauls built to fight off Caesars legions.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: Pompeii Rising
programme.sub-title: In 2010, the collapse of the Gladiators Barracks drew the worlds attention to the degraded condition of Pompeii; the European Community and the Italian Government have released 105 million euros to save the city.
programme.desc: An unprecedented rescue mission and archeological campaign was launched in Pompeii in 2018; leading experts worked together trying to find new clues surrounding a disaster that hit the city.

programme.title: Pompeii Rising
programme.sub-title: Its been eight months since the start of the new excavation project; a small street is discovered where different volcanic layers reveal the unfolding of the events of the Vesuvius eruption.
programme.desc: An unprecedented rescue mission and archeological campaign was launched in Pompeii in 2018; leading experts worked together trying to find new clues surrounding a disaster that hit the city.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: A team of experts investigate the methods Hitler used to indoctrinate Germany, turning it into a finely-tuned war machine; we visit Goebbels Propaganda Ministry and the holiday park of Prora.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: We witness the final moments and aftermath of World War II with the establishment of war crime trials - such as the ones in Nuremberg - and move towards peace with the creation of the United Nations.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: In the aftermath of the Great War, the victors sign the Treaty of Versailles. We begin this series by exploring the 20 years after World War One and the events that led to the birth of World War Two.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: In this episode, we explore the first few years on the European battlefield, from the invasion of France and the subsequent Dunkirk evacuation to Hitlers betrayal of his pact with Stalin.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: We examine key movements in the Pacific Theatre - the Fall of Singapore, the Battle of Midway and the Kokoda Campaign - Rommels offensives in Africa, and the Allied bombing campaign over Europe.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: The Axis forces begin to lose hold on their previous triumphs; between Japans loosening hold on southeast Asia and Germanys growing defeats in Europe, we begin to see WW2s turning of the tide.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Why Planes Vanish: The Mystery of Flight MH370
programme.desc: Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 disappeared with 239 passengers and crew on board on the 8th of March, 2014; this documentary looks at if new radio technology could help locate the missing aircraft.

programme.title: Tsunami: The Day The Wave Hit
programme.sub-title: Charlie is on the beach in Khao Lak with his dad Simon when the tsunami crashes into the hotel they are staying in; trapped in swirling water, Simon somehow saves Charlie from certain drowning.
programme.desc: We tell the story of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami through dramatic, and often heroic, individual stories with powerful - and sometimes unseen - archival footage while detailing the science behind it.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: North America seemed safe from the horrors of war for much of WWII, but a chilling discovery in the furthest reaches of eastern Canada hints at the true depths of the Nazis seafaring capabilities.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: This episode explores moments of the war where Allied forces started to push back: the relief of Leningrad, the liberation of Paris, D-Day and the liberation of the Nazi extermination camps.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: June 1944: the British and Canadians are still short of the objective they planned to capture on D-Day: the city of Caen. This episode tells the story of the bloody fighting for the city.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: The scars of centuries of conflict are etched into Italys ancient landmarks; this episode explores how it rose from the devastating failure of fascism to the rebirth of its identity.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Bomber: Terror of WWII
programme.sub-title: The ﬁrebombing of Tokyo signalled the power of the B29 bomber, the development of which exceeded in cost the Manhattan Project that produced the A-bomb.
programme.desc: There have been a catalogue of inventions in the history of warfare that have changed the way battles are fought, but one weapon changed not only the battlefield, but war itself: the bomber.

programme.desc: Kaks venda otsustavad reisil olles teha nalja vana raadioga. Kuid plaanitud naljal on vaga tõsised tagajarjed. Võib juhtuda, et neil tuleb oma kergemeelsuse eest eluga maksta. 2001

programme.title: Robotmonstrumid
programme.desc: Meditsiinitudengid satuvad tunnistajateks ebaõnnestunud võitlusrobotite katsetustele. Robotid tapavad Kambodža kulakese elanikud. Operatsiooni eest vastutavad CIA juhid ei kavatse jatta tunnistajaid.

programme.sub-title: Dr James must save a very special bird, Dr Hamish treats very cute Australian mammal Shug, and Dr Lucinda investigates why adopted pet cockatiel Snowy is laying an excessive number of eggs.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The Caribbean Sea is a mythical place with a wild jungle world living on its shores; this region is home to the axolotls, the Montezuma oropendola, dozens of species of tree frogs, and pit vipers.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy embarks on an epic mission to reveal the real creature behind the worlds most famous river monster - the Loch Ness Monster. Will he uncover the legend of legends?
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Surviving the Asteroid
programme.desc: 66 million years ago: a gigantic asteroid hits the Earth and wipes out the reign of the dinosaurs as no animal weighing more than 500 grams survives this catastrophe. Who are the survivors?

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: The Spinosaurus is one of the strangest dinosaurs to have ever lived; a discovery in Spain could help trace the origins of this mysterious beast.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: Investigators in the Badlands of Wyoming unearth the bones of a Mosasaur, a terrifying marine predator from the dinosaur age.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: If we had to pick one iconic African animal, it would be the elephant. Its ancestors have dominated the world and the five continents through an exceptional evolution.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We explore the diverse continent of South America and learn how a pod of orcas snatch seal pups from right under their mothers noses; meanwhile, a jaguar hunts the formidable caiman in the jungle.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Extreme Snakes
programme.sub-title: This is the story of how Australias snakes evolved, over millions of years, to thrive and become dominant predators in every ecosystem on one of the harshest and most extreme continents on Earth.
programme.desc: This two-part series takes you on an epic journey through the most harsh - yet exquisite - landscapes and habitats to uncover the remarkable world of Australia and Africas most extreme snakes.

programme.title: Extreme Snakes
programme.sub-title: Africas diverse snake species have surprisingly adapted to dominate each corner of one of Earths wildest terrains, evolving to thrive in the myriad of habitats of this biodiverse continent.
programme.desc: This two-part series takes you on an epic journey through the most harsh - yet exquisite - landscapes and habitats to uncover the remarkable world of Australia and Africas most extreme snakes.

programme.title: Planet Shark
programme.sub-title: Older than the dinosaurs, sharks have evolved to thrive in even the most hostile of environments; the full scale of their ingenuity is only just beginning to be uncovered.
programme.desc: Sharks are one of the oldest and successful hunters ever to have lived; they dominate every corner of our oceans, but what is it about these extraordinary survivors that makes them so successful?

programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peters under extra pressure with Charlie the horse - he belongs to his niece Jess; when Julian sees Jackie Barlow, its usually about one of her alpacas, but today the patient is her little dog Isla.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz on a ZCP lion-collaring mission, go fishing with scout Simon, study mealtime pack hierarchy and witness a heartbreaking vigil for a badly-injured Kakumbi pup.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Head back to the den with the Kakumbi - who are mourning the loss of two pups - and chance upon a hyena lair and a lion pride trying to take down a buffalo.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are attempting to rehabilitate a mentally ill young bull in the hospitals male herd, Kat gets her hands dirty with elephant poo, and Paul helps the vets treat an infected abscess.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr Jamess dad brings in Lucy, a wounded mangrove monitor lizard, Dr Kiara treats a wild echidna, and Dr Hamish must uncover the cause of Bernoulli the Alexandrine parrots behaviour changes.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack

programme.title: Patagonia: Earths Secret Paradise
programme.sub-title: We follow the path of the relentless wind from the Andes peaks sweeping east through Patagonias desert and discover a world of maras, penguins, and baby guanacos that are Patagonias very own camels.
programme.desc: This three-part series discovers the surprising stories of the unusual wildlife and the people that survive in epic Patagonian landscapes of volcanoes, glaciers, desert and treacherous oceans.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Julz discovers lions in Manzi territory and is relieved when he finds the dogs safe, a brave puku antelope foils a Kakuli pack hunt, and the Stork pack recovers after losing a pup.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: A future dispersal of young adult dogs in the Manzi pack looks inevitable, the dry season forces the Kakuli pack to take risks, and ecologist Henry identifies a new dog who has joined the Stork pack.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wonders of Mexico
programme.sub-title: The countrys driest region, northern Mexico is dominated by two great deserts called the Sonoran and Chihuahuan; as you travel west the conditions get hotter, drier, and more challenging.
programme.desc: This documentary series reveals Mexicos astonishing wildlife, landscape and culture as we pay a visit to the ancient temples of the Maya, the Sierra Madre, and the Sonoran and Chihuahuan deserts.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earths Secret Paradise
programme.sub-title: We follow the path of the relentless wind from the Andes peaks sweeping east through Patagonias desert and discover a world of maras, penguins, and baby guanacos that are Patagonias very own camels.
programme.desc: This three-part series discovers the surprising stories of the unusual wildlife and the people that survive in epic Patagonian landscapes of volcanoes, glaciers, desert and treacherous oceans.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Winter has begun as the Northern Hemisphere freezes; life is at its hardest with less solar energy, and the Arctic sun has set and wont return until the spring.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Transformation is enormous as the Northern Hemisphere starts to face the suns rays in March; spring is a season of opportunity as the great melt begins and new life erupts.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We explore the diverse continent of South America and learn how a pod of orcas snatch seal pups from right under their mothers noses; meanwhile, a jaguar hunts the formidable caiman in the jungle.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Extreme Snakes
programme.sub-title: This is the story of how Australias snakes evolved, over millions of years, to thrive and become dominant predators in every ecosystem on one of the harshest and most extreme continents on Earth.
programme.desc: This two-part series takes you on an epic journey through the most harsh - yet exquisite - landscapes and habitats to uncover the remarkable world of Australia and Africas most extreme snakes.

programme.title: Extreme Snakes
programme.sub-title: Africas diverse snake species have surprisingly adapted to dominate each corner of one of Earths wildest terrains, evolving to thrive in the myriad of habitats of this biodiverse continent.
programme.desc: This two-part series takes you on an epic journey through the most harsh - yet exquisite - landscapes and habitats to uncover the remarkable world of Australia and Africas most extreme snakes.

programme.title: Planet Shark
programme.sub-title: Older than the dinosaurs, sharks have evolved to thrive in even the most hostile of environments; the full scale of their ingenuity is only just beginning to be uncovered.
programme.desc: Sharks are one of the oldest and successful hunters ever to have lived; they dominate every corner of our oceans, but what is it about these extraordinary survivors that makes them so successful?

programme.title: Macaque Island
programme.sub-title: Explore the cityscape where fluffy male Matnoor rules over the 30-member-strong Street Troop with an iron fist, then meet Aarav, the old alpha who oversees the wilder Hill Troop.
programme.desc: Two street-smart troops of long-tailed macaques rule the forests and urban edges of Singapore; its all about turf wars, alpha male battles, and the complex lives of these sassy primates.

programme.title: Macaque Island
programme.sub-title: The Hill Troops invasion of their turf turns sour, the Sisterhood plot to kidnap Saras baby, and alpha Loci discovers that his old rival is back in town.
programme.desc: Two street-smart troops of long-tailed macaques rule the forests and urban edges of Singapore; its all about turf wars, alpha male battles, and the complex lives of these sassy primates.

programme.title: Macaque Island
programme.sub-title: A brawl erupts after the Street Troop finds the Hill Troop on their turf, Matnoor is displaying poor parenting skills, and alpha wannabe Ajit makes his move.
programme.desc: Two street-smart troops of long-tailed macaques rule the forests and urban edges of Singapore; its all about turf wars, alpha male battles, and the complex lives of these sassy primates.

programme.title: Secrets of the Enchanted Forests
programme.sub-title: Wade into wetlands where trees and water meet to nurture new life; dive into an underwater forest that protects young fur seals, visit a mangrove sanctuary, and meet some real-life swamp monsters.
programme.desc: Traverse the planets richest and most diverse woodlands - from the tropics to the poles and everywhere in between - and learn how forests connect and nurture the lives of countless species.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amanda rescues a blind pet baboon and Dr Charlotte operates on a pangolin whose leg must be amputated; two young baboons have gone AWOL, and we encounter a feisty monitor lizard.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James performs surgery on a tiny zebra finch; Dr Lucinda attends to Froggie, the green tree frog who is actually blue; Dr Shane treats a Macquarie turtle whose abscess has burst through its shell.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The highs and lows of the Andes create habitats that vary greatly, from bears and snakes low on the ground to condors, vicuñas, hummingbirds and quetzals up high in the hills and treetops.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter removes an oven glove from terrier Wesleys stomach and an optometrist spots a problem with his daughters pet rabbit Patch; Julian makes the difficult decision to remove an eye.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: A special episode focusing on births and babies; Julian heads to a local farm where a cow is struggling in labour, and baby goat Daisy has serious eye problems that are affecting her sight.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Return to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi, the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs, and yearling Snowy face a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Wekas pups.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.
